intro: Trophaeum aureum, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, narrow leaves. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological importance. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens and its ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
